meta.description:
Global package selection tree

The primary interface for installing ZenOS software categories. 
Setting a leaf node to `true` or `{}` triggers installation.

Batch processing idle interval

Idle time to wait after a file is added before creating a processing batch.
Whether to enable rule-based (dumb) file sorting.

Minimum batch age for processing

Minimum age of a batch folder before the Janitor processes it.

Directories monitored for automated sorting

Set of directories to monitor for automated sorting. Each entry 
represents a source path containing rules for moving files.
Whether to enable the ZenFS Janitor automated organization service.
Whether to enable machine learning-based classification.

Delimiters for multi-artist metadata tags

List of delimiters or regex patterns used to split multi-artist 
tags into discrete entries.
Whether to enable the Music Virtual Library FUSE mount.

FUSE mount point for virtual music library

The target directory where the virtual FUSE view will be mounted.

Source directory for raw music files

Path to the source directory containing raw music files to be 
indexed by the FUSE provider.
Alias for the global package selection tree

PWA application definitions

Attribute set mapping application names to their specific configurations.

Internal launch command generator

Function used to generate the execution string for a given application.
meta.type: function that evaluates to a(n) string

meta.description:
Internal WM_CLASS generator

Used to link windows to desktop entries for correct taskbar grouping.
meta.type: function that evaluates to a(n) string

meta.description:
Backend browser engine

Specifies the underlying engine for PWAs. Firefox is the primary 
supported backend; others may have limited feature parity.

Brave browser package for PWA execution

Specifies the browser package used to run Brave-based web applications. 
The package must support the `--app` and `--user-data-dir` flags.

Chrome browser package for PWA execution

Specifies the browser package used to run Chrome-based web applications. 
Supports google-chrome, chromium, or other chromium-based browsers 
that accept the same CLI flags.
Whether to enable internal URL dispatcher.

Fallback browser command

Command to execute for links that do not match any registered PWA pattern.
Whether to enable ZenOS WebApps declarative module.

Path to the Firefox GNOME theme directory

Enables seamless integration with the GNOME desktop by importing the
`firefox-gnome-theme` into generated PWA profiles. This ensures that
web applications match the system's Adwaita aesthetic.

List of packages containing native messaging hosts

Specifies packages that provide Firefox native messaging host manifests.
These will be linked and made available to the Firefox PWA edition.

Profile storage directory

Root path where all PWA browser profiles and configuration will be stored.

Global package selection tree

The primary interface for installing ZenOS software categories. 
Setting a leaf node to `true` or `{}` triggers installation.

Primary accent color for the interface

Sets the system-wide accent color for GNOME components and supported
GTK4 applications.

Enable system-wide dark mode

Whether to prefer the dark color scheme by default across the desktop
environment and applications.

Default favorite applications in the dock

List of .desktop file identifiers to be pinned to the GNOME Dash
by default.
Whether to enable Gnome Desktop Base Module.

Remove the default GNOME Console

When enabled, the modern GNOME Console (kgx) is added to the 
exclusion list for the environment.
Whether to enable Alphabetical App Grid GNOME extension configuration.

Position of folders in the grid

Where to place folders when ordering the application grid (e.g., 'alphabetical').

Enable system logging for the extension

Allow the extension to send messages to the system logs for debugging.

Display favorite apps in the grid

Allows displaying the favourite apps on the app grid (GNOME 40+).

Sort folder contents alphabetically

Whether the contents of folders should be sorted alphabetically.
Whether to enable App Hider GNOME extension configuration.

List of hidden application IDs

Applications that are hidden from the standard app grid.

List of applications hidden from search

Applications that are hidden specifically from GNOME Shell search results.

Custom icon overrides

List of [id, icon, path] tuples to manually override application icons.
Whether to enable AppIndicator GNOME extension configuration.

Visual brightness of tray icons

Adjustment level for the brightness of displayed icons.

Visual contrast of tray icons

Adjustment level for the contrast of displayed icons.

Alpha transparency of tray icons

Opacity level from 0 to 255 for icons in the top bar.

Visual saturation of tray icons

Adjustment level for the color saturation of displayed icons.

Fixed size for tray icons

Icon size in pixels. A value of 0 triggers automatic sizing.

Horizontal spacing between icons

Pixel distance between individual status icons within the tray area.

Enable legacy tray icon support

Whether to support older application status icons in the top bar.

Ordering index in the panel

Relative order for placement among other panel items.

Vertical alignment in the panel

Panel box position for the tray icons (e.g., 'left', 'right').

Menu toggle keyboard shortcut

Keybinding to open the applications menu.
Whether to enable Apps Menu GNOME extension configuration.
Whether to enable Astra Monitor GNOME extension configuration.

Experimental extension flags

Enable internal experimental features by passing flag strings.

Menu header height (Legacy)

Visual height of the dropdown menu headers.

Left horizontal margin

Pixel spacing on the left side of the panel item.

Right horizontal margin

Pixel spacing on the right side of the panel item.

Memory calculation method

Logic used to determine 'used' memory (active, etc.).

Network speed unit

Unit for bandwidth throughput (bits, bytes).

Panel box position

Placement of the monitor in the GNOME panel (left, center, right).

GPU visibility toggle (Legacy)

Deprecated setting for showing GPU usage in the menu.

GPU usage bar color (Legacy)

Color used for GPU monitoring bars.

Decimal precision for sensor 5

Number of digits to show for the fifth sensor tooltip.

Tooltip name for sensor 5

Custom label for the fifth sensor in tooltips.

Refresh interval for sensors

Time in seconds between resource usage updates.

Panel orientation

Shell bar position (top, bottom, left, right).

Storage usage calculation

Logic used to determine disk space consumption.

Unit for temperature display

Unit used for thermal sensors (celsius, fahrenheit).

Interface theme style

The visual theme for the monitor dropdown (dark, light).

Enable high precision sensor readings

Whether to show more decimal places for sensor values.
Whether to enable Auto Theme Switcher GNOME extension configuration.

Geographic latitude

Latitude coordinate used for sunset and sunrise calculations.

Geographic longitude

Longitude coordinate used for sunset and sunrise calculations.

Human-readable location label

Custom name used to identify the location in the user interface.
App grid folder blur settings
Application window blur settings
Coverflow integration settings
Dash to Dock integration settings
Dash to Panel integration settings
Whether to enable Blur My Shell GNOME extension configuration.
Global brightness adjustment for blur
Global color mix (GVariant tuple)
Apply color and noise filters globally
Enable verbose console output for debugging
Performance/Compatibility hack level (0-2)
Global film grain/noise intensity
Global noise lightness adjustment
Advanced effect pipeline definitions
Internal version tracker for settings
Global gaussian sigma (blur radius)
Hide Top Bar compatibility settings
GNOME lockscreen blur settings
Activity overview blur settings
Top panel blur settings
Screenshot UI blur settings
Window List extension blur settings

Currently selected animation profile

The filename of the active effect profile (e.g., 'fire.conf'). 
Overridden if 'settings' attribute is defined.
Whether to enable Burn My Windows GNOME extension configuration.

Internal version of the extension core

Tracks the version of the extension code for compatibility checks.

Internal version of last used preferences

Tracks updates between the preferences dialog and the extension core.

Preferences dialog interaction counter

Tracks how many times the settings interface has been opened.

Nickname of the effect for preview

The effect with this nick will be used for the next window animation.

Declarative effect parameters for the managed profile

Generates a custom INI profile at `~/.config/burn-my-windows/profiles/nix-managed.conf`.
meta.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string)

meta.description:
Display the ask-for-support dialog

Whether to allow the extension to show its periodic donation dialog.

Enable single-frame animation testing

If set to true, all animations will show only one still frame.
Allow toggling caffeine via command line signals

Active countdown remaining time

Internal timer state representing seconds remaining until inhibition ends.

Default timer duration index

The default index from the duration list used when starting a timer.

Available timer duration intervals

List of possible timer values in seconds for the dropdown menu.
Whether to enable Caffeine GNOME extension configuration.

Auto-inhibit on fullscreen apps

Enable caffeine automatically when any application enters fullscreen mode.

Auto-inhibit on media playback

Enable caffeine automatically when an MPRIS-compatible media player is active.
Visual offset for the status icon in the panel
Logical sorting index for the status icon
Maximum index for icon positioning in the indicator menu

Auto-inhibit application list

List of applications (desktop file IDs) that trigger caffeine when running.

Inhibit GNOME Night Light

Mode for suppressing Night Light: 'never', 'always', or 'for-apps'.
Default height for the preferences window interface
Default width for the preferences window interface

Restore inhibition state on startup

Whether to automatically re-enable caffeine if it was active on shutdown.

Allow screen blanking while active

Mode for allowing the screen to turn off: 'never', 'always', or 'for-apps'.

Indicator visibility mode

Controls the top bar icon visibility: 'only-active', 'always', or 'never'.

Display status notifications

Whether to show desktop notifications when caffeine is toggled.

Display countdown in top bar

Whether to show the remaining inhibition time next to the icon.

Enable quick settings toggle

Whether the toggle switch appears in the GNOME Quick Settings menu.

Keyboard shortcut to toggle state

List of key combination strings used to manually enable/disable caffeine.

Application trigger logic

Criteria for app-based inhibition: 'on-running', 'on-focus', 'on-active-workspace'.

Enable custom duration timer

Whether to use custom user-defined values for the inhibition timer.

Manual toggle state persistence

Whether caffeine should remember its enabled state across sessions.
Whether to enable Category Sorted App Grid GNOME extension configuration.

Reorder history on use

Whether to move items to the top of the history list 
when they are selected.

Automatic paste upon selection

When enabled, clicking a history item immediately pastes 
it into the active window.

Trim whitespace from text

When enabled, leading and trailing whitespace is automatically 
removed from copied text strings.

Enable image caching to disk

Whether the extension is permitted to persist copied image 
data in its disk cache.

Restrict disk cache to favorites

Disables the registry cache file for standard items, using 
volatile memory only to avoid writing secrets to disk.

Maximum registry cache size

The allowed size for the disk-based registry cache file 
in megabytes.
Whether to enable Clipboard Indicator GNOME extension configuration.

Enable history deletion controls

If true, displays 'delete' buttons on each item and provides a 
'Clear History' option in the menu.

Enable periodic history clearing

Activates the timer-based automatic purging of the 
clipboard history buffer.

Autoclear interval duration

Specifies the time in minutes between scheduled 
history purges.
Internal state tracker for the next scheduled clear

Clear history on system startup

When enabled, the clipboard history buffer is purged every 
time the system reboots.

Confirm history purge

Whether to show a confirmation dialog before performing a 
'Clear History' action.

Applications ignored by the extension

List of application identifiers whose clipboard activity 
should not be recorded in the history.

Preserve active selection during clear

Whether to retain the currently selected clipboard entry 
when performing a bulk history deletion.

History buffer size

The maximum number of copied items to persist in the 
clipboard history.
Shortcut to purge clipboard history
Enable extension keyboard shortcuts
Shortcut to cycle to the next history entry
Shortcut to cycle to the previous history entry
Shortcut to toggle Private Mode
Shortcut to display the clipboard menu

Show notification on new copy

Displays a desktop notification every time a new item 
is added to the clipboard.

Show notification during history cycling

Displays a notification when cycling through clipboard 
entries using keyboard shortcuts.

Enable immediate paste buttons

If true, adds a dedicated button to each menu entry that triggers 
an immediate paste action upon selection.

Position pinned items at the bottom

If true, reorders the clipboard menu to place the 'pinned' section 
at the bottom of the list.

Menu character preview limit

The maximum number of characters displayed for clipboard items 
inside the extension menu.

Topbar character preview limit

The maximum number of characters displayed for the current 
clipboard item in the GNOME top bar.

Case-sensitive history search

Whether the search filter should respect character casing.

Enable regular expressions in search

Allows using advanced regex patterns when filtering the 
clipboard history.

Panel display mode

Configures what information is displayed directly in the GNOME 
top bar (icon, text content, or both).

Show panel dropdown arrow

Whether to display a visual down-arrow indicator next to the 
clipboard icon in the top bar.

Animation time in milliseconds

Total duration for the window to transition between visible and minimized states.

Animation effect variant

Specifies the specific variant of the lamp effect to apply to windows.
Whether to enable Compiz Alike Magic Lamp Effect GNOME extension configuration.

Horizontal mesh density

Number of horizontal tiles used to construct the deformation mesh. 
Higher values produce smoother animations but increase CPU load.

Vertical mesh density

Number of vertical tiles used to construct the deformation mesh.
Whether to enable Compiz Windows Effect GNOME extension configuration.

Window movement friction

Determines how quickly window wobble energy dissipates. Lower values 
result in longer-lasting oscillations.

Simulated window mass

Determines the inertia of the wobble. Heavier windows feel 'sluggish' 
and wobble with greater amplitude.

Enable wobble on maximization

Whether windows should wobble when transitioning to a maximized state.

Enable wobble on manual resize

Whether windows should wobble while being resized by the user.

Animation speed divisor

Scaling factor for the overall speed of the physics simulation.

Spring stiffness constant

Determines the 'tightness' of the wobble effect. Higher values 
make windows snap back faster.

Horizontal mesh density

Determines the number of points on the X-axis used to calculate 
window deformation.

Vertical mesh density

Determines the number of points on the Y-axis used to calculate 
window deformation.
Threshold for recognizing an entry as a standalone character
Display the Unicode codepoint for single-character items
Whether to enable Copyous GNOME extension configuration.

Clipboard clearing behavior

Determines which items are preserved when the history is cleared.

Maximum clipboard history size

Specifies the number of entries to retain in the history buffer.

Record primary selection (Middle Click paste)

Whether to capture text selected by highlighting as a clipboard entry.

Secondary button click behavior

Action performed when clicking the secondary interaction button on 
an item.

Immediate paste upon selection

Automatically inserts the clipboard content when an item is 
selected from the menu.
Shortcut to cycle through different history filters
Shortcut to remove the focused item from history
Navigation key to move to the next item
Navigation key to move to the previous item
Shortcut to toggle the pinned status of an item
Shortcut to focus the history search bar
Shortcut to select and/or paste the focused item
Keyboard shortcut to show/hide the clipboard window
Custom CSS color for the window background
Custom CSS color for the text and icons
Base color scheme for custom theming
Extension color theme mode
Visibility mode for window header controls
Fixed vertical height for each clipboard list item
Visual orientation of the clipboard menu
Screen position of the floating clipboard window
Display the text content or filename of the clipboard entry
Display icons indicating the data type (text, image, etc.)
Height of the clipboard window as a percentage of screen height
Width of the clipboard window as a percentage of screen width

Transition duration in milliseconds

Determines the speed of window movements during the Alt-Tab cycle.
Override the default application switcher keybinding
Override the default window switcher keybinding
Gaussian blur radius applied to elements behind the switcher
Application forward shortcut
Application backward shortcut
Primary forward shortcut
Primary backward shortcut
Rotation angle for side-windows in Coverflow mode
Horizontal distance from the center for side-windows

Filter windows by workspace

Determines whether windows from other virtual desktops are 
included in the list.
Color saturation reduction for background elements

Background dimming intensity

Opacity level applied to the desktop background when switching windows.
Mathematical curve used for animation smoothing
Whether to enable Coverflow Alt-Tab GNOME extension configuration.

Force primary monitor display

Always render the 3D switcher on the primary display regardless 
of active window location.

Hide top bar during transition

Whether to temporarily suppress the GNOME panel visibility when 
the switcher is active.
Custom color for the active window highlight
Apply a visual glow when the cursor hovers over a preview
Inherit the system accent color for the highlight effect
Icon entry/exit animation style
Render drop shadows behind application icons
Visual representation style for application icons
Reverse the logic of touch/scroll gestures
Custom vertical offset for the switcher interface
Alpha transparency of the overlayed application icon
Pixel size for the application icon inside the switcher
Method for adjusting view for multi-monitor setups
Vertical alignment of the icon and window title
Preferences window height
Preferences window width
Scale factor applied to off-center preview windows
Maximum size of window previews relative to monitor dimensions
Bring the hovered window preview to the foreground
Apply slight variations to individual window movements
Unify application and window switching logic
Restricts the switcher to windows on the active monitor
Color used for the 3D stage background
Behavior when reaching the end of the window list
3D visual algorithm used to arrange window previews
Blending strength between original background and tint
Overlay tint color (GVariant tuple)
Use system accent color as the background tint
Apply a visual noise/glitch filter to the background
Apply a semi-transparent color overlay to the background
Enable detailed debug output
Display output from a custom shell command
CSS color (Hex or RGBA)
Font family name
Font size in points (20-96)
Typography style
Typography weight
Shell command to execute for output display
Show the lock screen date
CSS color (Hex or RGBA)
Font family name
Font size in points (20-96)
Typography style
Typography weight
Custom date format pattern
Whether to enable Customize Clock on Lockscreen GNOME extension configuration.
Show the 'swipe up to unlock' hint
CSS color (Hex or RGBA)
Font family name
Font size in points (20-96)
Typography style
Typography weight
Show the lock screen clock
CSS color (Hex or RGBA)
Font family name
Font size in points (20-96)
Typography style
Typography weight
Clock face rendering style
Custom strftime format pattern
Switch between open windows of the same app on icon click
Hide the focused window when its icon is clicked
Switch virtual workspaces by scrolling on the top panel
Maintain panel-dash visibility when in overview mode
Automatically enter activity overview when logging in
Whether to enable Dash In Panel GNOME extension configuration.
Fade the running indicator for apps not on the current desktop
Color running dots based on the application's primary icon color
Pixel spacing around application launch buttons
Center the taskbar/dash elements within the top panel
Pixel dimensions for application icons in the panel
Shift the clock and date menu to the right side of the panel
Vertical pixel height for the consolidated top panel
Display the 'Activities' label in the top bar
Display the 'Show Applications' grid button in the panel
Show application name tooltips when hovering over icons
Hide pinned favorites and only show active windows
Hex color for the dock background
Force use of the custom background color
Manually override min/max opacity levels
Maximum opacity when windows overlap
Minimum opacity when windows are not near
Fixed background alpha transparency
Alpha blending logic for the dock background
Marker outline color
Marker outline pixel thickness
Marker fill color
Manual marker color configuration
Inherit indicator color from the app icon
Visual style of the active application marker
Enable shell theme overrides
Apply a visual glossy effect to icons
Remove extra padding around the dock
Disable corner rounding for the dock background
Glow effects behind active icons
Standard click action
Action for Middle Click
Action for mouse scroll on icon
Action for Shift+Click
Action for Shift+Middle Click
Separate trash and mount indicators
Filter apps by hardware display
Filter apps by current desktop
Hide windows when clicking with Shift
Require cursor pressure to trigger revealing
Trigger threshold for edge pressure
Change desktop by scrolling on the dock
Visual transition duration
Pause before concealing the visible dock
Pause before revealing the hidden dock
Hide when the cursor is not near the edge
Always keep the dock visible
Hide the dock for fullscreen media/games
Avoid overlapping application windows
Intellihide behavior policy
Require explicit toggle for visibility
Show dock when apps request attention
Compatibility for bolt extensions
Keep apps button fixed to screen corner
Anchor apps button to the start of the dock
Display the application grid button
Display pinned applications
Display external storage icons
Display remote network shares
Hide unmounted device placeholders
Display active windows
Display the trash can icon
Render live thumbnails on interaction
Skip overview after login
Whether to enable Dash to Dock GNOME extension configuration.
Expand the dock to fill the entire screen edge
Maximum dock size relative to screen edge
Keep icons centered when in panel mode
Prevent the dock from shrinking icons
Target pixel size for application icons
Monitor hardware connector ID
Show dock on all available screens
Monitor index (-2 for primary)
Screen edge where the dock is anchored
Enable Super+Num launch keys
Display key numbers over icons
Show dock when hotkey is triggered
Duration of the numbers overlay
Shortcut to show/hide dock
Deformation curvature map

Direct schema-key overrides for dconf

Hiding trigger policy
Hide panel when obstructed by windows
Per-monitor panel lengths (JSON)

Placement of the active window marker

Override the calendar system (e.g., gregorian, islamic)
Override the default system locale for date rendering
Display time for a specific IANA time zone identifier
Whether to enable Date Menu Formatter GNOME extension configuration.
Pixel font size for the panel clock label

Backend formatting engine

Specifies the library used for parsing and rendering the date strings.

Custom date display pattern

Luxon-compatible formatting string (e.g., 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss').

Suppress the message counter

Whether to hide the unread message/notification indicator next 
to the clock.
Horizontal alignment of the date label within its panel slot

Clock refresh frequency

Determines update interval (0: minute, 1: second, 2+: sub-second).
Ignore the custom-calendar setting and use system defaults
Ignore the custom-locale setting and use system defaults
Ignore the custom-timezone setting and use system defaults

Extension entry action icon

Defines the function of the trailing button on each list item: 
0 for preferences, 1 for removal, or 2 for the extension URL.
Whether to enable Extension List GNOME extension configuration.

Activate extension filtering

When enabled, extensions listed in the ignore-list will be 
hidden from the top bar menu.

Enable extension name tooltips

Whether to show descriptive tooltips when hovering over the 
toolbar extension list items.

Target application for management

Specifies the application ID used to open extension management 
tools or web pages.

Display the main extension toggle button

Controls visibility of the primary switch used to enable or 
disable the individual extensions.

Display management filter button

Shows or hides the button used to manage ignored or filtered 
extensions in the list.

Display link to extension homepage

Adds a button to each entry that opens the developer's 
website or the GNOME extensions page.

Display ignore list toggle button

Shows a button that opens the menu for managing which 
extensions are hidden.

Identifiers for hidden extensions

List of extension UUIDs or names that should not appear 
in the extension list menu.

Show ignore list management menu

Whether to display the sub-menu used for selecting 
extensions to be hidden from view.

Display extension removal button

Adds a button to each entry that allows for the immediate 
uninstallation of the extension.
CSS color for focused border
Focused window border pixel thickness
Display border on focused window
CSS color for split indicator
Display split direction indicator
Display preview area during drag-and-drop
Display tab decorations for stacked windows
Suppress gaps for single windows
Multiplier for gap size adjustments
Base gap size between tiled windows
Whether to enable Forge GNOME extension configuration.
Internal CSS schema version
Timestamp of the last CSS injection
Enable extension event logging
Verbosity level for extension logs
Add Forge toggle to system quick settings
Layout used for drops into window center
Keep floating windows above tiled ones
Follow-mouse focus policy
Sync pointer location with keyboard focus changes

Define as a list of keys, e.g., [ "super" "q" ]. 
Supported modifiers: super, ctrl, alt, shift.

Enable browser integration features

Configures native messaging manifests to allow sharing links 
directly from web browsers to remote devices.

Enable verbose troubleshooting logs

Activates detailed logging for diagnostic purposes.

Default plugin policies for paired devices

A set of default plugin settings that are automatically 
pushed to dconf for every newly paired device.

Make machine visible on local network

Whether this system should announce itself via MDNS for 
remote device discovery.
Whether to enable GSConnect GNOME extension configuration.

Master switch for extension functionality

Enables or disables the GSConnect background service and shell integration.

Unique machine identifier

The UUID or identifier used to register this machine within 
the KDE Connect network.

Maintain background connections during lock

Ensures that devices remain paired and reachable even when the 
desktop session is locked.

Network broadcast name

The human-readable label shown to other devices when 
discovering this machine on the local network.

Display connection status in top bar

Whether to show the persistent connection status and device 
indicators in the GNOME panel.
Whether to enable Hide Cursor GNOME extension configuration.

Idle threshold for cursor hiding

Specifies the number of seconds of mouse inactivity before 
the cursor is automatically concealed.
Whether to enable Hide Minimized GNOME extension configuration.

Autohide transition speed

Duration in seconds for the panel slide animation during 
standard reveal/hide events.

Overview transition speed

Duration in seconds for the panel slide animation when 
entering the overview.
Whether to enable Hide Top Bar GNOME extension configuration.

Restrict intellihide to active window

When enabled, only the focused window triggers the panel 
hiding logic.

Enable smart hiding logic

Only hides the panel when a window occupies the panel area.

Maintain hot corner sensitivity

Whether to keep the activities hot corner active even when the 
panel is hidden.

Maintain rounded panel corners

Preserves the aesthetic rounded corners of the top panel 
even in its hidden state.

Reveal panel on mouse proximity

Whether to show the panel when the mouse cursor approaches the 
edge of the screen.

Enable mouse reveal in fullscreen

Allows revealing the panel via mouse proximity even when a 
fullscreen application is active.

Trigger overview on edge proximity

Whether to open the activity overview when the mouse hits 
the panel edge.

Edge pressure barrier limit

The amount of cursor 'pressure' (pixels) required to break 
the reveal barrier.

Pressure barrier reset time

Time in milliseconds before the pressure barrier resets 
after a failed break attempt.

Manual reveal persistence

Number of seconds the bar remains visible after being 
triggered by a keyboard shortcut.

Panel visibility keyboard shortcut

List of key combinations used to manually reveal the top bar.

Enable shortcut toggle mode

If enabled, pressing the reveal shortcut while the bar is 
visible will manually hide it.

Show panel in activities overview

Whether the panel should always be rendered when the 
overview is active.

Transparency level of the mouse trail, where 0.0 is invisible 
and 1.0 is fully opaque.

or performance.

Force normal priority for all notifications

Treats all incoming notifications as normal priority, preventing them 
from persisting indefinitely even if sent with high priority.

user is currently active or idle.

be dismissed from the screen.

to the first window.

Enable the curated ZenOS GNOME extension set

When enabled, this installs a pre-selected set of extensions 
designed to work together for a premium desktop experience.

Extensions to exclude from the curated set

A list of extension names (e.g., 'forge') that should be 
skipped even if the curated set is enabled.

Enable ZenOS typography stack

Activates the Atkinson Hyperlegible and ZeroFont overrides for 
system-wide UI, documents, and terminal monospaced fonts.

Enable the Zero GNOME clock font tweak

When enabled, this modifies the typography of the shell clock to match 
the ZenOS aesthetic using ZeroMono and ZeroClock fonts.

Enable Variable Refresh Rate support

Activates experimental VRR support in Mutter for compatible high-refresh
rate gaming monitors.
Alias for the global package selection tree

Enable the Syncthing service

Whether to activate the Syncthing file synchronization daemon. This 
implementation uses the ZenOS abstraction layer to map settings to 
the underlying legacy service.
Whether to enable the ZenBoot bootloader manager.

Arbitrary bootloader configuration lines

Text content to be appended directly to the generated bootloader 
configuration file.

Supplementary configuration file attributes

Attribute set of extra configuration files to be linked and 
included by the primary boot configuration.
meta.type: null or (attribute set of absolute path)

meta.description:
Boot menu screen resolution

Sets the resolution for the UEFI frame buffer during boot. 
Format: WIDTHxHEIGHT.

Boot device discovery list

Comma-separated list of device types to scan for bootable partitions 
(passed to the internal 'scanfor' command).

Animated glow effect color

The hex color code (without #) used for the breathing glow effect 
surrounding the primary icon.
The device identifier or hostname shown on the boot screen

Operating system name display

The primary text label shown below the hostname on the boot screen.
Whether to enable ZenOS Plymouth boot animation.
The hardware or brand icon displayed in the center of the screen
The version or release string displayed alongside the OS name
Trigger store optimization and GC during system reboot
Trigger store optimization and GC during system shutdown
Whether to enable ZenOS Maintenance System.

Retention period for Nix store garbage

Duration after which inactive generations and unreferenced store paths 
are eligible for deletion. Example: '14d', '30d'.

User alert interval for maintenance tasks

Determines how often the user is notified about completed cleanup 
or pending updates.

Declarative attribute set of system packages to install

Attribute set of system packages to be automatically resolved and 
installed. Leaf nodes can be empty sets to trigger automatic lookup 
in nixpkgs.

Complete version string

The final constructed version identifier combining major version, variant, 
and release type. If the type is 'beta', it may include specific revision data.

Major version identifier

The primary version number assigned to the current ZenOS release cycle.

Release lifecycle type

Defines the stability track of the current release (e.g., 'beta', 'stable').

Version variant code

Indicates the edition or flavor of the release, such as 'N' for the 
NixOS-based edition.

Declarative user configurations with automatic integration

Defines ZenOS-specific user settings that are automatically 
mapped to both standard NixOS user options and Home Manager.

List of files ignored by ZenFS indexing

Patterns or filenames that should be skipped by the roaming and 
categorization services.
Whether to enable ZenFS system-wide integration.
Whether to enable roaming user profile support.
Percentage of disk usage that triggers offloading logic
Target disk usage percentage after successful offload

Customized version of the Forge GNOME tiling extension

**Forge (Custom)** is a modified build of the Forge GNOME extension, 
tailored specifically for ZenOS. It includes specific tweaks and 
patches to ensure compatibility with modern GNOME versions and 
integrates seamlessly with the ZenOS tiling workflow.

**Features:**
- Native-like tiling window management for GNOME Shell.
- ZenOS-specific compatibility patches and workflow tweaks.

ZenLink status indicator and control interface for GNOME

**ZenLink Indicator** provides a status icon and control interface for the 
ZenLink service. It integrates directly into the GNOME control center or 
top bar, offering quick access to device pairing, file transfers, and 
notification settings.

**Features:**
- Visual status indicator for connectivity.
- Quick access menu for common actions.

GNOME Shell top bar clock typography override

**Zero GNOME Clock** is a custom GNOME Shell theme component that overrides the 
default top bar clock font. It uses the custom "Zero" font to provide a minimal 
and stylized clock appearance.

**Features:**
- Applies the "Zero" font family to the clock display.
- Uses `@font-face` injection via generated CSS.
- Includes dconf profile setup for user theme integration.

Automatic music tagger and renamer

**Swisstag** is a powerful CLI tool for automatically tagging and organizing 
music collections. It uses MusicBrainz and other sources to fetch metadata, 
lyrics, and cover art, ensuring a clean and consistent music library.

**Features:**
- Fingerprinting via AcoustID (chromaprint).
- Metadata retrieval from MusicBrainz.
- Automated lyrics fetching via Genius.

Convenience wrapper for nixos-rebuild switch

**zenos-rebuild** is a wrapper script around `nixos-rebuild switch` 
specifically designed for the ZenOS environment. It provides automated 
session management and user feedback.

**Features:**
- Automates the rebuild and switch process.
- Provides desktop notifications via libnotify.
- Runs inside a tmux session for resilience.

ZenOS bootloader automation based on rEFInd

**ZenBoot** is an automated bootloader management tool for ZenOS, built on top 
of rEFInd. It handles the generation of boot entries, manages EFI variables, 
and applies the ZenOS branding to the boot stage.

**Features:**
- Automatic generation of rEFInd configuration.
- Integrated system profile versioning.
- Themed boot menu with custom icons.

Automated system maintenance and optimization utility

The ZenOS Maintenance package provides an intelligent background service that
optimizes the system during idle periods. 

**Features:**
- **Smart Idle Detection:** Monitors CPU load to run tasks when user is away.
- **Garbage Collection:** Automatically clears old Nix store paths.
- **Notifications:** Alerts the user when maintenance is completed.
Modified Adwaita icon pack with more icons
meta.longDescription:
**Adwaita Hacks** extends the standard Adwaita icon theme with additional icons
needed for a complete ZenOS experience. It fills in gaps where standard Adwaita
might be missing specific application or system icons.

**Features:**
- Additional icons matching the Adwaita style.
- Seamless integration with the default icon theme.

meta.description:
ZenOS signature typeface for UI and terminals

**Zero Font** is a custom typeface designed for the ZenOS aesthetic.
It includes a standard and condensed variant, optimized for UI legibility 
and high-DPI displays.

**Features:**
- Custom glyphs and ligatures.
- Precise hinting for UI rendering.

Extended Adwaita icon pack for ZenOS compatibility

**Adwaita Hacks** extends the standard Adwaita icon theme with additional 
icons needed for a complete ZenOS experience. It fills in gaps where 
standard themes are missing specific application or system icons.

**Features:**
- Additional icons matching the Adwaita aesthetic.
- Seamless integration with the default GNOME icon theme.

Core iconography set for the ZenOS environment

**ZenOS Icons** provides the central brand iconography for the ZenOS 
desktop environment. It includes system icons, folder symbols, and 
app icons designed to match the brand's minimal aesthetic.

**Features:**
- Consistent visual style across all sizes.
- High-quality scalable vector graphics (SVG).

ZenOS fastfetch theming and ASCII art

**ZenOS Fastfetch** provides a custom configuration for `fastfetch` that aligns 
with the ZenOS brand. It wraps the standard `fastfetch` binary to load the 
ZenOS preset and ASCII art by default.

**Features:**
- Custom ZenOS ASCII art.
- Pre-configured JSONC preset.
- Global availability without user-level configuration.

Branded Plymouth boot animation for ZenOS

**ZenOS Plymouth Theme** provides a high-fidelity boot animation featuring 
animated typography and a custom breathing glow effect. It dynamically 
generates assets based on the system's branding configuration.

**Features:**
- Dynamic OS name and version label generation.
- Hardware-specific center iconography.
- Configurable animated glow effect color.

Custom rEFInd bootloader theme for ZenOS

**ZenOS rEFInd Theme** provides a clean, modern look for the rEFInd 
bootloader. It includes custom icons, high-resolution backgrounds, 
and configuration settings optimized for the ZenOS minimal aesthetic.

**Features:**
- Fullscreen high-detail banner support.
- Branded icon sets for various operating systems.
- Streamlined UI hiding unnecessary boot elements.
